content:
y 12
												This game is one of the most revolutionary games of the century. Not only does it have cunning graphics and engaging gameplay, but is a true modern art form that can easily be related to Picasso and Vincent van Gogh. Garfield Kart acts as a basis in which all games in the future shall follow. I call for Garfield Kart to be added as the 11th commandment as it is a game and world we all shall follow. I can highly recommend this game to anyone, the rich, poor, and working class as this game can appeal to anyone in any outreach of the world. Why, this game should be displayed 24/7 on a screen in Times Square, for all to see and enjoy as everyone should have at least 12% of their daily diet being lasagna. Our government leaders and representatives shall play this game as well, as it will increase the chances they start a Garfield Kart Fund and a Lasagna Fund. Although I now have to conclude this review, I do not know where to end. This game simply cannot be described in a paragraph... or with words for that matter. It shall be explained through easily interpreted body and hand movements along with the soothing sound of a cat chewing lasagna. However, this review must come to a slow and sickening end. My final statement on the matter is this: this game is not worth five dollars... It is worth the life of a cat and his lasagna, worth the world. If you do not enjoy this game, there is simply something wrong and you need to contact your doctor immediately for support. All show your support for this flawless and innovative game and let it live on!

content:
ber 15, 2016
												Garfield Kart is a racing game developed by Gravity Europe releasing on PC in November 2013. The game has also been released on Nintendo 3DS previously as well. We have all come to know what to expect from kart racing games from the likes of Mario Kart in the past. Most kart games that have come out to try and rival Mario Kart have often fallen flat on their face. Prior to playing Garfield, I had played another kart racing game on Steam, Coffin Dodgers and sadly that didn’t live up to the mark. Garfield Kart is almost an identical game to that of Coffin Dodgers. Gameplay is going to be simple when it comes to kart racing, simply beat your opponents in the race around a circuit. There are 16 different courses to race around with 8 different powerups to collect around the circuits too. The game’s tutorial is back to front when it comes to explaining the controls; whether they did it with a different controller in mind I am not sure, but the controls on an Xbox controller were the complete opposite to shown on the screen. Garfield Kart has three different game modes to play, Grand Prix, Single Race and Time Trial. Grand Prix is the more structured part of the game, where you take part in 4 or 5 races at a time in a league, depending on where you finish in the races will determine how many points you get. Single Race is more like the “free mode”, whilst you can gain money from competing in races here; there aren’t any huge rewards for winning. Time Trial is what you would expect from a Kart Racing game; nothing too exciting and certainly the least interesting of the three modes. There is one final game mode which is where Garfield does something a little different to the rest of the Kart Games on Steam. A daily challenge mode is included, complete the set task and you will get a reward at the end of it. This is a really easy way to gather better upgrades for your car without having the need to grind out money by replaying previous tournaments. Graphically, Garfield Karts looks really nice. It looks like one of the cartoons, with some really nice modelling, textures and animations on show. The game’s environments are all very nicely designed as well. The sound effects do let the game down a little bit; it can sometimes seem too quiet at times. Your engine noise can almost seem too quiet for it to seem realistic which something which felt really odd when playing is. The sound track is really catchy though. Garfield Kart has three levels of difficulties. Whilst you are not able to choose the difficulties per race, you choose which bracket of difficulty race to take part in; 50cc, 100cc and 150cc. Obviously the higher the number the more powerful the rest of your opponents cars will be. In order to even be competitive in the 100cc and 150cc bracket, you will have to completely upgrade your car using the upgrade system; you are able to purchase items for your car which will improve three criteria of performance, speed, handling and power. You will also be able to choose from a selection of helmets which will also grant you a specific bonus for individual power ups which you can collect. Whilst I really liked the upgrade system, it does feel very much like a grind to unlock items as you have to replay previously won competitions in order to get anywhere close to being able to buy anything. I would have personally liked to have seen a reduction in the price set on the items so you aren’t forced to replay already played content if you don’t want to. The daily challenge mode helps with this, but only if you play the game in small doses. I have been playing for over an hour so far and I have just completed the first bracket of races whilst also taking part in the daily challenge and a couple of time trials. There is easily another 3 or 4 hours of content from this game. Sadly the game will have very little staying power and I will more than likely not play the game again after completing the three stages of difficulty. With the lack of any multiplayer mode, the developers have really shot themselves in the foot of making game out of a genre which is so perfectly crafted for any type of multiplayer action.As the Steam page says for this game, there is only partial controller support for this game. The gameplay itself works well with a control, however you have to navigate menus with your mouse, making a bit awkward to play on a couch setup. There is a wide selection of resolutions to play on, right the way up to 4k, with minimal graphic options to change. To sum up, Garfield Kart is purely an OK game. There aren’t any glaringly obvious negative points; it’s just not going to blow your socks off with exciting game play moments and hilarious local multiplayer. The only thing that resembles Garfield in this game is the character models; there is no story, no voice acting, and nothing else that makes this game any different to a generic kart racer. Luckily the game is priced low at £5, 59, and for that price you will get some enjoyment out of it, just don’t go into it expecting all the bells and whistles of Mario Kart. I’ve marked it down as a 3 on my scale, it’s not the best game, but it certainly isn’t a bad game either. If you can get it less than the sale price, you will want to consider checking it out for an hour or two of action.

28, 2016
												Garfield Kart (Gar-feeld Cart) is a cult classic devolped by Rockstar Studios, Bethesda, ID Games, Blizzard Entartainment, 2K Games, and Telltale, and Valve. It was made in 2014, and still holds up today as one of the greatest games EVER made. The frame rate is always a steady 300fps, and the story elements Telltale put in the game makes it shine even more. In this game, Garfield is on an epic journey to find the key to the vault that leads to the golden lasagna. Along the way he meets other important friends and strong enemies, such as Odie (whom he kicks into orbit so he can retreive the map (SPOILER!!!)) Jon, the main antagonist who sends talon company to hunt down garfief. This is where the word "Kart" shines. garfield must use his "i hate Mondays' powered kart to get to his goal, the key to the golden lasagna.The driving physics are top of the line, it makes you wanna push to get 1st place. The shooting mechanics devolped by Rockstar are top of the line, you never see the same reload animation twice in a row. The graphics surpass Fallout 4, MGS 5: The Phatom Pain, and The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim Remastered.I dont think a 10/10 is a high enough score for this game, this needs to be put into a time caspule and given to the people of the future just to pass on the tradition of Garfield kart.

												Garfield Kart, memery aside certainly is not a horrible game. However, keep a few things in mind:1. If you are trying to give this to someone you dislike, it may not be worth it because Garfield Kart is not that horrible; get Bad Rats instead for that.2. If you are looking for a quality kart racer don't buy this. It definitely is passable but not really worth 5 dollars.3. If you are looking for a game to give to a young kid it may be good, however, my computer (Gtx 960 2gb, 16gb of ram, and a i5) lags horribly in certain areas on max settings and never exceeds 60 anywhere. 4. If you have made many Garfield Cart jokes you probably should buy this.Also a few things about actual gameplay:1. The bots will scale in items which is BS because you will never truly have an edge over the bots.2. No online.3. No split-screen.4. Bots will sometimes have impossibly fast reactions at 100cc and up.5. Grinding is essential so get the hang of it.Hope this helps.

content:
y 3
												Lasagna Fun Facts: Lasagne is a wide, flat pasta shape and possibly one of the oldest. As with most other types of pasta, the word is a plural form, lasagne meaning more than one piece of lasagna ribbon. The word also refers to a dish made with this type of pasta in several layers interspersed with layers of various ingredients and sauces.Lasagne originated in Italy, in the region of Emilia-Romagna.July 29th is National Lasagna Day.Traditionally, the dough was prepared in Southern Italy with semolina and water and in the northern regions, where semolina was not available, with flour and eggs.Originally, in Italy, the word “lasagna” did not refer to a food (in fact, today, the food is still spelled “lasagne” as the plural form). The word “lasagna” referred to the pot in which the food was cooked. It is thought that the word “lasagna” for the pot is derived from the Greek word for “chamber pot.The earliest lasagna recipes known are dated from the thirteenth century. At that time, tomatoes were not known to Europeans. This means that they couldn’t have used them in the recipes. However, depending on the recipe, different cheeses are used.Boiling noodles used to be a requirement for making lasagna. No-boil noodles now exist. These are great as they soften in the oven, but it is absolutely necessary to make sure that there is a great quantity of sauce so the noodles get wet and cook while they are in the oven.You can make lasagna in the dish washer. All you have to do is put the ingredients together in a dish (either boils noodles or use the no boil noodles), cover the dish tightly with aluminum foil, then use the heated dry and sanitize cycle on your dishwasher to cook the lasagna.The most well-known bit of lasagna lore is probably that the cat, Garfield, from the comic strip, has lasagna as his favorite food.Weird Al Yankovic recorded a song called “Lasagna” that is a parody of “La Bamba”.

Everyone in the town lives by the following rule: If a husband cheats on his wife, the husband is executed as soon as his wife finds out about him. All the women in the town only gossip about the husbands of other women. No woman ever tells another woman if her husband is cheating on her.  So every woman in the town knows about all the cheating husbands in the town except her own. It can also be assumed that a husband remains silent about his infidelity. One day, the mayor of the town announces to the whole town that there is at least 1 cheating husband in the town. What do you think happens?pls help me with my math

content:
y 29
												Truly a masterpiece. Can not recommend enough. For those thinking of purchasing, I strongly bellieve you should. This game follows Garfield as he struggles to stay happy in a world where mondays have taken over. he teams up with Jon, Liz, Odie, Squeak, and many other characters from the expanded Garfield universe (Don't worry. If you have no knowledge of the lore or expanded universe, there's a brief summary in the beginning.) to defeat the Monday Menace, the main villain of the game. As the game progresses, Garfield's love of lasagna hinders him but also keeps him going, as he knows that destroying Mondays once and for all will mean endless amounts of lasagna for him and his friends. Garfield meets new friends along the way, but also loses some. I will stop here, to avoid spoiling it for those thinking of purchasing. The one thing I will say is that you might want to keep a box of tissues nearby, as the ending is a tearjerking farewell to a character we know and love.Garfield Kart is work of art. If this game is not in your library, put it on your wishlist. This game goes on sale every summer and winter sale, for only $1.49, which isn't too much for a game worth a million dollars such as this one.

29, 2016
												a true game of inspiration. This game is the root of all joy and happiness in this depressing world. Anyone who doesn't have gradfeld karti in their library is  a lost soul, and nothing else. Odie is our true lord. He will always be our savior and our father. Every night i bow down to Odie and let him cleanse my soul. I fall asleep listening to the classic gradfeld move from cartoon netwoek. I will always be one with Odie, and noo one can change that. I would do anything for odie. He has gifted us with this beautiful game from the angles. I will never take Odie for granted, and always see him as my father and one true lord. Gradfield and Odie are said to fight on Earth one day, and when that day comes, I will be ready for Odie to take me to his home. Odie and Gradfeld are the true lord of this world, and when they fight, there will be no survivors. I will be brought to paradise because of my true faith in Odie. I can trust Odie to do anything for me, and you can trust him to do anything for you. All you have to do is buy this game. $15 is a small price to pay for infinite peace. I will travel  to Odie land and eat all the lasaga I want because there are no fat cats to stop me from eating all the lasaga in the world. Soon gradfeld will fall, and when he does, all the non believers will fall with him.

												You can't play as Lyman. That's really all you need to know.This is a kart racing game based on Garfield. Because all the kids are crazy for Garfield. It was very obviously made for a phone touchscreen, many of the menus only work when you realize that it's expecting you to swipe with the mouse. It looks pretty bad, yet it runs surprisingly poorly. In all, it's exactly the game you would expect from a PC port of a smartphone game based on a licensed character nobody has cared about for at least two decades.

content:
ry 20
												According to all known lawsof aviation, there is no way a beeshould be able to fly. Its wings are too small to getits fat little body off the ground. The bee, of course, flies anyway because bees don't carewhat humans think is impossible. Yellow, black. Yellow, black.Yellow, black. Yellow, black. Ooh, black and yellow!Let's shake it up a little. Barry! Breakfast is ready! Ooming! Hang on a second. Hello? - Barry?- Adam? - Oan you believe this is happening?- I can't. I'll pick you up. Looking sharp. Use the stairs. Your fatherpaid good money for those. Sorry. I'm excited. Here's the graduate.We're very proud of you, son. A perfect report card, all B's. Very proud. Ma! I got a thing going here. - You got lint on your fuzz.- Ow! That's me! - Wave to us! We'll be in row 118,000.- Bye! Barry, I told you,stop flying in the house! - Hey, Adam.- Hey, Barry. - Is that fuzz gel?- A little. Special day, graduation. Never thought I'd make it. Three days grade school,three days high school. Those were awkward. Three days college. I'm glad I tooka day and hitchhiked around the hive. You did come back different. - Hi, Barry.- Artie, growing a mustache? Looks good. - Hear about Frankie?- Yeah. - You going to the funeral?- No, I'm not going. Everybody knows,sting someone, you die. Don't waste it on a squirrel.Such a hothead. I guess he could havejust gotten out of the way. I love this incorporatingan amusement park into our day. That's why we don't need vacations. Boy, quite a bit of pomp...under the circumstances. - Well, Adam, today we are men.- We are! - Bee-men.- Amen! Hallelujah! Students, faculty, distinguished bees, please welcome Dean Buzzwell. Welcome, New Hive Oitygraduating class of... ...9:15. That concludes our ceremonies. And begins your careerat Honex Industries! Will we pick ourjob today? I heard it's just orientation. Heads up! Here we go. Keep your hands and antennasinside the tram at all times. - Wonder what it'll be like?- A little scary. Welcome to Honex,a division of Honesco and a part of the Hexagon Group. This is it! Wow. Wow. We know that you, as a bee,have worked your whole life to get to the point where youcan work for your whole life. Honey begins when our valiant PollenJocks bring the nectar to the hive. Our top-secret formula is automatically color-corrected,scent-adjusted and bubble-contoured into this soothing sweet syrup with its distinctivegolden glow you know as... Honey! - That girl was hot.- She's my cousin! - She is?- Yes, we're all cousins. - Right. You're right.- At Honex, we constantly strive to improve every aspectof bee existence. These bees are stress-testinga new helmet technology. - What do you think he makes?- Not enough. Here we have our latest advancement,the Krelman. - What does that do?- Oatches that little strand of honey that hangs after you pour it.Saves us millions. Oan anyone work on the Krelman? Of course. Most bee jobs aresmall ones. But bees know that every small job,if it's done well, means a lot. But choose carefully because you'll stay in the jobyou pick for the rest of your life. The same job the rest of your life?I didn't know that. What's the difference? You'll be happy to know that bees,as a species, haven't had one day off in 27 million years. So you'll just work us to death? We'll sure try. Wow! That blew my mind! "What's the difference?"How can you say that? One job forever?That's an insane choice to have to make. I'm relieved. Now we only haveto make one decision in life. But, Adam, how could theynever have told us that? Why would you question anything?We're bees. We're the most perfectlyfunctioning society on Earth. You ever think maybe thingswork a little too well here? Like what? Give me one example. I don't know. But you knowwhat I'm talking about. Please clear the gate.Royal Nectar Force on approach. Wait a second. Oheck it out. - Hey, those are Pollen Jocks!- Wow. I've never seen them this close. They know what it's likeoutside the hive. Yeah, but some don't come back. - Hey, Jocks!- Hi, Jocks! You guys did great! You're monsters!You're sky freaks! I love it! I love it! - I wonder where they were.- I don't know. Their day's not planned. Outside the hive, flying who knowswhere, doing who knows what. You can'tjust decide to be a PollenJock. You have to be bred for that. Right. Look. That's more pollenthan you and I will see in a lifetime. It's just a status symbol.Bees make too much of it. Perhaps. Unless you're wearing itand the ladies see you wearing it. Those ladies?Aren't they our cousins too? Distant. Distant. Look at these two. - Oouple of Hive Harrys.- Let's have fun with them. It must be dangerousbeing a Pollen Jock. Yeah. Once a bear pinned meagainst a mushroom! He had a paw on my throat,and with the other, he was slapping me! - Oh, my!- I never thought I'd knock him out. What were you doing during this? Trying to alert the authorities. I can autograph that. A little gusty out there today,wasn't it, comrades? Yeah. Gusty. We're hitting a sunflower patchsix miles from here tomorrow. - Six miles, huh?- Barry! A puddle jump for us,but maybe you're not up for it. - Maybe I am.- You are not! We're going 0900 at J-Gate. What do you think, buzzy-boy?Are you bee enough? I might be. It all dependson what 0900 means. Hey, Honex! Dad, you surprised me. You decide what you're interested in? - Well, there's a lot of choices.- But you only get one. Do you ever get boreddoing the same job every day? Son, let me tell you about stirring. You grab that stick, and you justmove it around, and you stir it around. You get yourself into a rhythm.It's a beautiful thing. You know, Dad,the more I think about it, maybe the honey fieldjust isn't right for me. You were thinking of what,making balloon animals? That's a bad jobfor a guy with a stinger. Janet, your son's not surehe wants to go into honey! - Barry, you are so funny sometimes.- I'm not trying to be funny. You're not funny! You're goinginto honey. Our son, the stirrer! - You're gonna be a stirrer?- No one's listening to me! Wait till you see the sticks I have. I could say anything right now.I'm gonna get an ant tattoo! Let's open some honey and celebrate! Maybe I'll pierce my thorax.Shave my antennae. Shack up with a grasshopper. Geta gold tooth and call everybody "dawg"! I'm so proud. - We're starting work today!- Today's the day. Oome on! All the good jobswill be gone. Yeah, right. Pollen counting, stunt bee, pouring,stirrer, front desk, hair removal... - Is it still available?- Hang on. Two left! One of them's yours! Oongratulations!Step to the side. - What'd you get?- Picking crud out. Stellar! Wow! Oouple of newbies? Yes, sir! Our first day! We are ready! Make your choice. - You want to go first?- No, you go. Oh, my. What's available? Restroom attendant's open,not for the reason you think. - Any chance of getting the Krelman?- Sure, you're on. I'm sorry, the Krelman just closed out. Wax monkey's always open. The Krelman opened up again. What happened? A bee died. Makes an opening. See?He's dead. Another dead one. Deady. Deadified. Two more dead. Dead from the neck up.Dead from the neck down. That's life! Oh, this is so hard! Heating, cooling

content:
y 26
												First things first, it's a fun game. However, I wouldn't recommend it right now because the controls are broken, big time. The default setting is steering with arrow keys, so I tried rebinding the keys to WASD. This worked, once. Every single time after, the game would rebind the keys so that both a and d turned left, or vice versa. I went to the discussion boards for some help, but it seems like there is no solution for the moment. With no way to restore defaults, I literally cannot play the game, which is a shame considering I love Garfield, the graphics, and the gameplay. If this issue gets addressed I will absolutely update my review, but at this point in time it's not worth it.

content:
ber 23, 2016
												Overall:The game is great. I recently built my new pc for running this game only and I have to say I am impressed I am pulling off a consistent 30fps for my £10,000 pc on all the lowest settings.. The game shows the most amazing mechanics that no other game has used before, such as items used for enhancments and attacking. Garfield cart is a very fun, high quality, intense racing game which in all honesty is the best I have ever played. The fact it can offer such smooth racing with a realistic feel is amazing, as the realism matched with the pure fantasy makes my wildest dreams come true. Graphics:Better than any other game out there so far, so good that even my 8k monitor can't match what was truly intended. One issue for some may be that you can't process the pure magic of these graphics with your current components. Fear not, as this game offers the highest quality optimisation for your machine.Sound:A very unique interesting range of sounds. I often find myself jamming to the main menu music, and feeling the intesity of the final lap when everything speeds up and gets the adrenaline pumping.

18, 2016
												This game is honestly the best Mario Kart installment from Nintendo ever! The addition of Garfield characters and getting rid of Mario was an amazing, but risky move to make on Nintendo's part. I'm still baffled on how they even got the rights to the Garfield characters. The controls, as you would imagine, are smoother than ever before, and the new items are top knotch. The addition of pies, lazagna, and UFOs really fit the new Garfield style. So, overall I would say this game is a MUST BUY, and it's only 5 dollars so why not!

ber 17, 2016
												Don't even buy this game as a joke.-This game is badly optimized-It's a port of an existing mobile game-The controls are so bad it makes you play Twister on your keyboard-Some of the background music has an annoying high frequency that can, literally, give you a bad migrain-The collision psychics barely exist-There's no catching up on racers ahead of you-Power Ups are pixel-perfect-Very boring when there is no obstacles-In-Game purchases needed to help you win-You only get 1 track and the rest need to be payed forIt may not seem that bad the way you look at it, but all of these problems are legit and serious, this is indeed one of the worst racing games ever, Big Rigs is better than this crap.You are better off buying a $50 2DS off Amazon and a used $20 copy of Mario Kart 7.

content:
ry 28, 2016
												So essentially i'm doing this and them i'm going to bed. Got this game as a gift from my good friend Maren (thanks for the gift) and i was pretty happy because i actually like Garfield very much, i grew up watching his cartoons and i love kart games, specially those on Steam (take a hint "Mario Kart") so i was pretty excited to play this one, installed and played a race. First thing is the usual progression system that i'm not fully sure if you have to pay for stuff like candy crush (the boosters) or for the characters but i only had Garfield and Jon and 1 track to select, also there was this big "Microtransctions" sign in the menu, no customisation options, no directimput or ximput support and the frames... the race started at 60 fps and i think that was the last time, god the anwful framerates of this game, every turn was like a jump in time, for a port of a 3ds game so WHY? thing is i'm deleting it and never playing it again. Do not buy.

content:
r 24, 2015
												Garfield Kart is a karting game similar to Mario Kart & Modnation Racers.  You race, get weapons, and shoot at your opponents.  I saw people complaining about the graphics and the controller set-up, I have not had any frame rate issues and I am playing on the highest setting.  I also hooked up my Xbox controller to my PC and tested it out and it works better than the keyboard, in my opinion, and I have not had any issues with it and it was easy to set-up. Lots of custimaztion options for your caracters and kart.  Very fun game and I highly recommend this game for anyone that likes racing games!

content:
r 20, 2015
												Garfield Kart is a fun racing game with wacky gameplay mechanics and an easy to master control system! It comes packed with a wide variety of levels, graphic options and a really well-done tutorial.The game has a cartoony interface and simple control inputs, but is unique enough to be classed as a desktop game rather than feeling like a mobile port. It's reminiscent of Sonic Racing in many ways, with its stylish visuals and sound design.Recommended! :)

ry 7, 2016
												This is the new Bad Rats. This is an extremely poorly optimized port of a mobile game; my system has an i5 4690K, 8 gigs of RAM, and an r9 390, and the game hardly ever goes above 30 fps, even dropping to 10 on Medium settings at 1080p. I set up my controller to play, and when I started I had to use the mouse to select the options, and the game ws already asking for me to buy things! Once I got into the race, my controls were very different, and for some reason the right trigger pawsed the game. Turning is nonexistant, and you have to completely rely on drifting, but drifting only worked the first time I used it in any race, so I consistantly lost because I couldn't turn at all. If you want to make better use of your time, make your own Kart racing game, even if you just roll your head on the keyboard to program it it'd probably turn out better. I got this as a gag gift and I feel like I wasted money.

												This game is fun for just messing around but it would be a lot of fun if it were full controller supported and multi player. With no motivation to play and beat other players I'm probably going to set it aside and play it once or twice a year if that. I got this game in a bundle and thought it would be fun. For the $.50 (if that much) that went towards this game, I was right. It's entertaining if you've got nothing else going on and don't want to take a game too seriously but the lack of multi player really takes away from what this game could be. For the $8 normal price tag or the $2 sale price, I would say this game isn't worth the buy. If you get it in a bundle it's worth it as long as you don't buy the bundle for this game. I wouldn't spend the money to buy this game at all because of the lack of key features that are supposed to be with games like these.

ber 16, 2016
												ADOLF HITLER: EARLY YEARS, 1889–1913Related ArticlesCommentsHow to cite this articleBaptized a Catholic, Adolf Hitler (1889–1945) was born on April 20, 1889, in the Upper Austrian border town Braunau am Inn, located approximately 65 miles east of Munich and nearly 30 miles north of Salzburg.His father, Alois Hitler (1837–1903), was a mid-level customs official. Born out of wedlock to Maria Anna Schickelgruber in 1837, Alois Schickelgruber changed his name in 1876 to Hitler, the Christian name of the man who married his mother five years after his birth. Alois Hitler's illegitimacy would cause speculation as early as the 1920s—and still present in popular culture today—that Hitler's grandfather was Jewish. Credible evidence to support the notion of Hitler's Jewish descent has never turned up. The two most likely candidates to have been Hitler's grandfather are the man who married his grandmother and that man's brother.LINZ  In 1898, the Hitler family moved to Linz, the capital of Upper Austria. Seeking a career in the visual arts, Hitler fought bitterly with his father, who wanted him to enter the Habsburg civil service. After his father's death, Hitler eventually persuaded his mother, Klara Hitler, née Pölzl, to permit him to pursue his dream to become an artist. As she lay dying of breast cancer in the autumn of 1907, Hitler took the entrance exam to the Vienna Academy of the Arts and failed to gain acceptance. In early 1908, some weeks after Klara's death in December 1907, Hitler moved to Vienna, ostensibly in the hope of renewing efforts to win acceptance in the Academy of Arts.VIENNA  Hitler lived in Vienna between February 1908 and May 1913. He had grown up in a middle-class family, with relatively few contacts with Jewish people, in a region of the Habsburg state in which many German nationalists had been disappointed that the German Empire founded in 1871 had not included the German-speaking regions of the Habsburg Monarchy. Yet the legacy of the Vienna years is not as clear as Hitler depicted it in his political autobiography. His impoverishment and residence in homeless shelters began only a year after his arrival and after he had frittered away a generous inheritance left by his parents and rejected all arguments of surviving relatives and family friends that he embark upon a career in the civil service.By the end of 1909, Hitler knew real poverty as his sources of income dried up. That winter, however, helped briefly by a last gift from his aunt, he began to paint watercolor scenes of Vienna for a business partner and made enough to live on until he departed for Munich in 1913. It is likely that Hitler experienced and possible that he shared the general antisemitism common among middle-class German nationalists. Nevertheless, he had personal and business relationships with Jews in Vienna and was, at times, dependent in part on Jews for his living. This may have been a cause for discretion about his actual feelings about Jews. It was not until after World War I that Hitler can be demonstrated to have adopted an “antisemitic” ideology.INFLUENCES UPON HITLER IN VIENNA  Hitler was genuinely influenced in Vienna by two political movements. The first was the German racist nationalism propagated by the Upper Austrian Pan-German politician Georg von Schönerer. The second key influence was that of Karl Lueger, Mayor of Vienna from 1897 to his death in 1910.Still in power when Hitler arrived in Vienna, Lueger promoted an antisemitism that was more practical and organizational than ideological. Nevertheless, it reinforced anti-Jewish stereotypes and cast Jews as enemies of the German middle and lower classes. Finally, unlike Schönerer, who was always more comfortable with the elitist nationalism of the student fraternities, Lueger was comfortable with big city crowds and knew how to channel their protest into political gain. Hitler drew his ideology in large part from Schönerer, but his strategy and tactics from Lueger.

content:
er 24, 2016
												IntroductionThis is the first game I've ever had the urge to write a formal review for. That may be because I enjoyed it much much more than I expected, or because I struggle with it, even as someone who's played 'hardcore' games for a very long time. This game is well worth your money.Rating10/10. Great combat, though a little stiff, great story and atmosphere. Well worth the money.In DetailGarfield Kart is an incredibly difficult, incredibly punishing game about discovery and chaotic, blood-pumping combat. To this day, I have only discovered a total of three games that give me an unforgettable adrenaline rush in the combat: Rust, Dark Souls, and Garfield Kart. It is not a game you will understand within an hour, or maybe even two. It took me just under three hours to get the full grasp of the combat, and to become a competent player. You will get angry. Garfield Kart is much like Dark Souls in atmosphere and writing style, in that nothing is handed to you through the story, you piece it together through parchment and books scattered all over the dungeon the game takes place in.Garfield Kart is also said to be part of a larger project known as Sui Generis, been in development since November 2014 if I'm correct, and for a prototype, it's incredibly well done. Although the animations and combat movement seem a bit stiff, it is still incredibly satisfying. Garfield Kart has, probably the most satisfying combat in any game I've played. The physics-based gameplay make it possible to knock an enemy off their feet with a high-impact weapon, or occasionaly tangle yourself into them so much that they are knocked off their feet. Nothing is more satisfying than smacking someone in the face with a sledgehammer and seeing them topple to the ground in Garfield Kart.This is all said with only barely mentioning the writing - which has a very admirable air of mystery and some, more subtle horror elements to it. It's dark, gritty and bloody, and incredibly interesting. It's unfortunate I didn't know that you could interact with items in the environment until a few hours into play.Top notch work, one of my favourite  games to date.

er 21, 2016
												I wanted to love this game when I got it. Unfortunately, love only really turned into kind of like. I do enjoy the game play. The carts are pretty easy to control. Their movements are not difficult. It is very reminiscent of Mario Kart, which is what I was hoping for. So in that respect, I am happy. You get power ups that effect you in different ways. In addition, you get power ups that you can throw at others, or drop behind you, again, just like Mario Kart. For that reason, I do recommend the game, for game play, and nastalgia. With that said, there are several negatives which made me no love this game.1--Music cannot be turned off. Turn off the music, you turn off all the sound effects. They are not seperate from one another.2--The cart does NOT make sounds. The only sounds that the cart makes is if you skid. To me, this reduces much of the fun of this game. A simple engine sound, with excelleration sounds and deceleration would make me LOVE this game. Unfortunately, it really falls short. I know, engine sound doesn't seem like a major deal. But, when you are playing a game that has a motorized vehicle in it, if that vehicle has no motor, and all you have is this heavily anooying music, it gets lame fast.3--The settings screen, from what I have seen, does not really have any settings.4--My game played in a small windowSo would I recommend this game? Yes, but barely. Would I recommend paying full price for this game? Absolutely not!

												“The true name of Satan, the Kabalists say, is that of Yahveh reversed; for Satan is not a black God, but the negation of God. The Devil is the personification of Atheism or Idolatry. For the Initiates, this is not a person, but a force, created for good, but which may serve for evil. It is the instrument of Liberty or free will. They represent this Force, which presides over the physical generation, under the mythologic and horned form of the God Pan; thence the he-goat of the Sabbat, brother of the Ancient Serpent, and the light bearer or Phosphor, of which the poets have made the false Lucifer of the legend”.Albert Pike Morals and Dogma, Ancient and Accepted Rite of Free Masonry written and published in 1871. Plagiarized from History of Magic published in 1860 written by Eliphas Levi, born Alphonse Louis Constant. Here is his version of the paragraph:“According to the Kabalists, the true name of Satan is that of Yahveh reversed, for Satan is not a black god but the negation of Deity. He is the personification of Atheism and Idolatry. The devil is not a personality for initiates but a force created with a good object, though it can be applied to evil: it is really the instrument of liberty. They represented this force, which presides over physical generation, under the mythological figure of the horned god Pan, and hence comes the goat of the Sabbath, brother of the old Serpent, the light-bearer or phosphorus, converted by poets into the false Lucifer of the legend”.“Science is the highest form of Satanism”.“Hate those that earn it, as you would love those that earn it. As Above, so below”.“When the world is viewed with no set reality, the lies of society are revealed and the bonds of slavery, broken”.– Rev. Michael S. Margolin“93, a Satanist by definition, which admittedly is a term that varies widely, is a rebellious soul in defiance of everything that he or she opposes that restricts them. The only sin of a Thelemite is ‘restriction’ which is why I’ve always argued that we are in a sense a satanic breed. So, in my thinking, ‘Thelema’ and ‘Santanism’ are kindred souls, both questing for the same thing, i.e. Freedom from slave gods. So it would be redundant to use both terms together, no? However, if you define “Thelemic Satanist” as a person who thinks the modern Thelemic movement has sold itself out and gone wishy-washy-white-Light on us, then by all means use both terms to imply your defiance to those Thelemites who act more like closet Christians than soldiers of Freedom. In other words, “Thelemic Satanist” could then imply a rebellious Thelemite fighting against those who use the name (i.e. Thelemite) but act more like the slave gods imposing restriction on our Creed. The bottom line, to use the phrase or not – there is no law but do what thou wilt! 93 93/93”.                     -Jerry Edward Cornelius, current head of the A:.A:. – Astrum Argentum  Grady Louis McMurtry Lineage.

content:
er 21, 2016
												I wanted to love this game when I got it. Unfortunately, love only really turned into kind of like. I do enjoy the game play. The carts are pretty easy to control. Their movements are not difficult. It is very reminiscent of Mario Kart, which is what I was hoping for. So in that respect, I am happy. You get power ups that effect you in different ways. In addition, you get power ups that you can throw at others, or drop behind you, again, just like Mario Kart. For that reason, I do recommend the game, for game play, and nastalgia. With that said, there are several negatives which made me no love this game.1--Music cannot be turned off. Turn off the music, you turn off all the sound effects. They are not seperate from one another.2--The cart does NOT make sounds. The only sounds that the cart makes is if you skid. To me, this reduces much of the fun of this game. A simple engine sound, with excelleration sounds and deceleration would make me LOVE this game. Unfortunately, it really falls short. I know, engine sound doesn't seem like a major deal. But, when you are playing a game that has a motorized vehicle in it, if that vehicle has no motor, and all you have is this heavily anooying music, it gets lame fast.3--The settings screen, from what I have seen, does not really have any settings.4--My game played in a small windowSo would I recommend this game? Yes, but barely. Would I recommend paying full price for this game? Absolutely not!

content:
y 6, 2016
												GOTY 2016-2020 I had so much fun jumping while wanting to drift and bumping into invisible walls. The port is pretty decent. You can get 24-54 FPS with a GTX 770 and a i5 4570, so I think you cant moan. The graphics are top notch. In some situations the game looks even better than Witcher 3. Of courede there are some small issues like constantly not loading backgrounds or textures, but that's not to bad I guess. The gameplay is very easy to learn, but hard to master. There are currently 35 maps with infinite ways to solve them. The puzzles are unique,  challengin and very creative. The story about an italian cat searching for his princess seems a bit ripped off, but it is very well executed and even brought some tears to my eyes. Definitely worth the 10$.

												This to me is a remake of Mario Karting on an old 64. Jump and slide for boost and collect weapons to use during the race. Same ase mario kart just the drivers, cars, weapons, and levels are different. I have played with both a keyboard and a steam controller and I do have to say once you set up you controller, thats the way to play the game. Charchters were done really well and so were the levels. Not the most detailed work but its for a cartoon game so the graphic quality is quite nice. Just dont get irritated like I did when it seems like every other car is faster. Its because they are and you need to utilize your boosts and weapons to come out on top in the end. I give this game a 7 out of 10 because they sould have made this game with FULL controller support.

r 18, 2015
												Looking for that purr-fect kart racer? Look no further than Garfield Kart! If you're a fan of a certain lasagna-loving, Monday-hating tubby fella (and who isn't!) then you owe it to yourself to check this little under-the-radar gem out. Sure, the production value isn't quite up to par with that of another well-known kart racer that, let's be honest, is becoming a little long in the tooth, but the sheer amount of enthusiasm the developers have for our favorite feline franchise is evident in every nook and cranny of this lovingly crafted title. Beautiful 1080p graphics and a whimsical color pallete bring Garfield's world to fluid, 60-fps life and it's a truly sublime experience to finally race through the environments that Jim Davis let us escape to for so many years. The power up items are all clever nods to the comic - Garfield's favorite pasta dish (if you're a true fan, enough said on what this could be!) allows him and his friends to perform heart-pounding, tooth gritting boosts to the karts - as well as to the player's heart rate as the adrenaline starts to surge! The famous (or infamous?...) spring is also present, enabling players to finally re-enact all of their favorite spring-related antics from the comic strip. Character and kart customization options allow for endless replayablility, plus playing dress-up with our furry friends is a joy in and of itself (ever wish you could just slap a chef's hat on Odie? Wish no more, your prayers have been answered!).I could go on, but hopefully if you've read this far I've already convinced you to give this game a shot. If you have even the slightest interest in Garfield, Kart racing, or video games in general then don't let this one pass you by!

												Family Guy is an American adult animated sitcom created by Seth MacFarlane for the Fox Broadcasting Company. The series centers on the Griffins, a family consisting of parents Peter and Lois; their children Meg, Chris, and Stewie; and their anthropomorphic pet dog Brian. The show is set in the fictional city of Quahog, Rhode Island, and exhibits much of its humor in the form of cutaway gags that often lampoon American culture.The family was conceived by MacFarlane after developing two animated films, The Life of Larry and Larry & Steve. MacFarlane redesigned the films' protagonist, Larry, and his dog, Steve, and renamed them Peter and Brian, respectively. MacFarlane pitched a seven-minute pilot to Fox in 1998, and the show was greenlit and began production. Shortly after the third season of Family Guy had aired in 2002, Fox canceled the series, with one episode left unaired. Adult Swim burned off the episode in 2003, finishing the series' original run. However, favorable DVD sales and high ratings for syndicated reruns on Adult Swim convinced the network to renew the show in 2004 for a fourth season, which began airing on May 1, 2005.Since its debut on January 31, 1999, 282 episodes of Family Guy have been broadcast. Its fifteenth season began on September 25, 2016. Family Guy has been nominated for 12 Primetime Emmy Awards and 11 Annie Awards, and has won three of each. In 2009, it was nominated for an Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Comedy Series, the first time an animated series was nominated for the award since The Flintstones in 1961. Family Guy has also received criticism, including unfavorable comparisons to The Simpsons.Many tie-in media have been released, including Stewie Griffin: The Untold Story, a straight-to-DVD special released in 2005; Family Guy: Live in Vegas, a soundtrack-DVD combo released in 2005, featuring music from the show as well as original music created by MacFarlane and Walter Murphy; a video game and pinball machine, released in 2006 and 2007, respectively; since 2005, six books published by Harper Adult based on the Family Guy universe; and Laugh It Up, Fuzzball: The Family Guy Trilogy (2010), a series of parodies of the original Star Wars trilogy. In 2008, MacFarlane confirmed that the cast was interested in producing a feature film and that he was working on a story for a film adaptation.A spin-off series, The Cleveland Show, featuring Cleveland Brown, aired from September 27, 2009, to May 19, 2013. "The Simpsons Guy", a crossover episode with The Simpsons, aired on September 28, 2014.[2] Family Guy is a joint production by Fuzzy Door Productions and 20th Century Fox Television and syndicated by 20th Television.[3] In 2013, TV Guide ranked Family Guy the ninth Greatest TV Cartoon of All Time.[4]

												The September 11 attacks (also referred to as 9/11) were a series of four coordinated terrorist attacks by the Islamic terrorist group al-Qaeda on the United States on the morning of Tuesday, September 11, 2001. The attacks killed 2,996 people, injured over 6,000 others, and caused at least $10 billion in property and infrastructure damage and $3 trillion in total costs. Four passenger airliners operated by two major U.S. passenger air carriers (United Airlines and American Airlines) — all of which departed from airports on the northeastern United States bound for California — were hijacked by 19 al-Qaeda terrorists. Two of the planes, American Airlines Flight 11 and United Airlines Flight 175, were crashed into the North and South towers, respectively, of the World Trade Center complex in New York City. Within an hour and 42 minutes, both 110-story towers collapsed, with debris and the resulting fires causing partial or complete collapse of all other buildings in the World Trade Center complex, including the 47-story 7 World Trade Center tower, as well as significant damage to ten other large surrounding structures. A third plane, American Airlines Flight 77, was crashed into the Pentagon (the headquarters of the United States Department of Defense) in Arlington County, Virginia, leading to a partial collapse of the building's western side. The fourth plane, United Airlines Flight 93, initially was steered toward Washington, D.C., but crashed into a field in Stonycreek Township near Shanksville, Pennsylvania, after its passengers tried to overcome the hijackers. It was the deadliest incident for firefighters and law enforcement officers[5] in the history of the United States, with 343 and 72 killed respectively. Four passenger airliners operated by two major U.S. passenger air carriers (United Airlines and American Airlines) — all of which departed from airports on the northeastern United States bound for California — were hijacked by 19 al-Qaeda terrorists. Two of the planes, American Airlines Flight 11 and United Airlines Flight 175, were crashed into the North and South towers, respectively, of the World Trade Center complex in New York City. Within an hour and 42 minutes, both 110-story towers collapsed, with debris and the resulting fires causing partial or complete collapse of all other buildings in the World Trade Center complex, including the 47-story 7 World Trade Center tower, as well as significant damage to ten other large surrounding structures. A third plane, American Airlines Flight 77, was crashed into the Pentagon (the headquarters of the United States Department of Defense) in Arlington County, Virginia, leading to a partial collapse of the building's western side. The fourth plane, United Airlines Flight 93, initially was steered toward Washington, D.C., but crashed into a field in Stonycreek Township near Shanksville, Pennsylvania, after its passengers tried to overcome the hijackers. It was the deadliest incident for firefighters and law enforcement officers in the history of the United States, with 343 and 72 killed respectively. The destruction of the World Trade Center and nearby infrastructure caused serious damage to the economy of Lower Manhattan and had a significant effect on global markets, closing Wall Street until September 17 and the civilian airspace in the U.S. and Canada until September 13. Many closings, evacuations, and cancellations followed, out of respect or fear of further attacks. Cleanup of the World Trade Center site was completed in May 2002, and the Pentagon was repaired within a year. On November 18, 2006, construction of One World Trade Center began at the World Trade Center site. The building was officially opened on November 3, 2014. Numerous memorials have been constructed, including the National September 11 Memorial & Museum in New York City, the Pentagon Memorial in Arlington County, Virginia, and the Flight 93 National Memorial in a field in Stonycreek Township near Shanksville, Pennsylvania.

												rather terrible.- Single player only. for a mario kart game clone. Dont expect this game to last long. You will get bored after a cople of hours.- Gamepad (MS x-box 360 was tested) only works in a race. In the main menu you have to SLIDE with your mouse (when there is a list of options to choose from). Like its some sort of mobile game port.- Hats to wear. (and unlock). WHY??? Is this a F2P game?- You have to buy ANYTHING with the coins. you just have 2 cars and 2 persons. The rest should be unlocked. (hats too). - spoilers that add speed/and other stats... IMO very cheap and uncreative implementetaion of a game's progress.TLDR: dont bother. The AI is simple, and there is no multiplayer at all. I know the game looks fun and promising, but that will last for 2 hours max. This game is unfinished and is not worth money at all.The devs spend developing time on something that doesnt matters like hats but didnt even added local co-op. Something that would add a huge value to the game.Why?

												Game of the decade for me, within the ranks of The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt, The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim, Half Life 2, and Grand Theft Auto V. Where do I begin? The stunning visuals make it difficult for my GTX 970 to maintain 60fps when I am boosting past my opponents. The 4k textures really shine in this game with thorough detail through and through. The plot of the story makes the campaign a joy to play, I constantly wondered what was going to happen next and couldn't put the game down for weeks after launch. For its low entry cost, you owe yourself as a gamer to buy this game, you will not be disappointed. 100/100. Perfect.

												This Game has honestly changed my life in so many different ways its unbelievableI started this game with a goal just to have fun but since I have downloaded this game it has changed me emotionally and physical, I hated everything in the world at the time before this game and everyone. And i've learned to love everything and accept everyone for who they are and what they do. I love almost everything in the world besides bad people. And I am now a 230lb 6'2 Alpha Male and jacked, ive also gotten a wife since playing this game and now we have two kids one named Jared From Subway, and the other Tyler Mutha ♥♥♥♥♥ 1. Anyway I just want to thank the developer so much for changing my life for the good and making my life the best I could ever live. Amen.
